Entry.JapaneseText: 男と女が口をきいちゃいけないなんて まったく変な街だな。
Entry.EnglishText: It's so weird that men and women can't talk to each other in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街ではそれが当たり前の事だ。 地域による習慣差はどこにでもある。
Entry.EnglishText: That's considered normal in this town. There are different customs everywhere.

Entry.JapaneseText: そういう事はペトナジャンカにも あるんじゃないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Are there no such customs in Petnadjanka?

Entry.JapaneseText: 習慣差ねえ……おれの場合で言うと…… 「ハチミツ入りマーボー豆腐」かなぁ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Different customs... Well, for me, there's this Mabo Curry with honey, I guess?

Entry.JapaneseText: サイコーにうまいのに、 なっかなか理解されないんだよなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's super tasty, but no one seems to understand that...

Entry.JapaneseText: それは<Tytree>だけ!! ボクたちにそんな料理食べさせないでヨ！
Entry.EnglishText: Because you're the only one who makes it that way! Don't go trying to feed it to the rest of us!
